alert.note: Alert for Adams; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 10:21PM CST until February 27 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Wintry Mix of Precipitation Moving in Sunday Night... .A powerful storm system will bring widespread precipitation to the region Sunday night and Monday. Initially, temperatures will be in the 20s, with a wintry mix of freezing rain and snow north of where the rain occurs. The precipitation type will hinge on what the surface temperatures are and accumulations will depend on how long the temperatures remain below freezing. Winds will also increase from the east, thus impacts may be elevated due to trees and power lines being coated with ice. Areas near and north of Interstate 94 have the greatest potential to see a quarter of an inch or more of ice accumulation. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Freezing rain, occasionally mixed with snow. Ice accumulations of one to three tenths of an inch possible and total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Trempealeau, Jackson, Monroe, Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
